As Assam bans polygamy, data shows practice on decline across India, most common among tribals
Uddhav Thackeray slams BJP over advisory curbing use of ‘Vande Mataram’ in Rajya Sabha: ‘Must oppose hyprocrisy’
Mt Semeru to Hayli Gubbi: Is the world seeing more volcanic eruptions? Explained
description: Recent major volcanic eruptions in Indonesia and Ethiopia have sparked questions about increasing activity. However, experts state there's no evidence of a global rise, attributing perceived increases to better monitoring and reporting. Historical data shows fluctuations, with periods of conflict disrupting documentation. Around 1,350 potentially active volcanoes exist globally, many along the Pacific's Ring of Fire.

title: Why Sir Ken Robinson said schools ‘educate people out of their creative capacities’
description: Sir Ken Robinson’s iconic TED warning about schools and creativity still reads like a diagnosis of today’s classrooms. From fear of being wrong to the quiet exile of the arts, students are trained to trade imagination for safety, compliance and marks. His charge that schools “educate people out of their creative capacities” now feels less provocation than stark lived description.

title: India-Russia annual summit: Putin to visit India on Dec 4-5, defence ties, trade on table
Abused by mother, Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi actress was forced to dance for money, was beaten with hunters, shoes
India to host Sri Lanka Women for five-match T20I series next month
Andrej Karpathy to educators: Stop trying to catch AI-generated homework
With 7 days to go, 74% of SIR forms digitised, says Election Commission; 100% in Lakshadweep, UP lags at 55%
IIM Mumbai launches postgraduate diploma in Public Policy, admissions based on CAT, GMAT, GRE, IMAT score
Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli can for sure play the 2027 World Cup: Morne Morkel
Anupam Kher says Vidhu Vinod Chopra refused him leave despite high fever during 1942: A Love Story: ‘Shoot karenge, theek hojayega’
Sourav Ganguly’s wife Dona lodges complaint with Kolkata Police: ‘Obscene, body-shaming remarks on social media’
University of Worcester invites PG students to apply for scholarships for Jan 2026 intake
Le’Veon Bell unveils massive 50-carat chain honoring 'Killer B' era
description: Le'Veon Bell showcased his career journey through a custom diamond-encrusted chain. The piece features symbols representing his time at Michigan State, his success with the Pittsburgh Steelers, his boxing career, and his music ventures, creating a wearable timeline of his life.

title: Dr Madhu Chopra is not a fan of applying sunscreen indoors, encourages all to embrace ‘gentle rays of the early morning and late evening’

High Court quashes NSA against Assam MLA Aminul Islam, 6 months after he was detained for Pahalgam comments
BNP chairperson and ex-premier Khaleda Zia’s condition ‘extremely critical’: Alamgir
In the past 10 years, no major urban Indian city has achieved safe air quality levels: What a new analysis says
US-India trade pact by year-end? Top trade official shares update; adds caution
description: India aims to finalize the initial phase of its Bilateral Trade Agreement with the US by year-end, with commerce secretary Rajesh Agarwal expressing optimism despite global trade shifts. Negotiations have advanced significantly, though last-minute hurdles remain a possibility. Discussions are also progressing on an immediate Framework Trade Deal to address US tariffs on Indian goods.

title: MAMA Awards 2025 Winners LIVE Updates: IVE, Enhypen bag three awards each; ‘APT’ is Song of the Year
Bollywood heroine’s career ended after superstar’s slap caused facial paralysis, husband cheated on her with sister
Muzaffarnagar groom rejects Rs 31 lakh dowry, accepts only Re 1 as ‘shagun’: ‘This is bride’s father’s hard-earned money’
MLB rumors: Red Sox eye Alex Bregman as No.1 free-agent target
description: Following their playoff exit, the Boston Red Sox are aggressively pursuing top offensive talent for the 2026 season. Alex Bregman, who previously played for Boston, is their primary target. If negotiations falter, the team is also eyeing Pete Alonso, Kyle Schwarber, Kazuma Okamoto, and J.T. Realmuto to bolster their lineup.

title: A curriculum without calculation: The risks of UGC’s math overhaul
The growing divide: Why employees are losing connection with employers in 2026
description: Glassdoor’s Worklife Trends 2026 reveals a workplace strained by declining trust, shifting power dynamics, and AI-driven upheaval. Leadership ratings have fallen sharply as workers report rising misalignment, poor communication, and eroding opportunities—especially for remote staff. With key industries facing heightened instability, the report warns that rebuilding trust between leaders and employees will define workplace stability in 2026.

title: Have any tiring activities coming up? Learn how 'sleep banking' can make you more focused
description: Sleep banking means getting extra sleep ahead of time to build up a reserve against upcoming sleep loss. This practice helps reduce the drop in alertness, focus, and performance when sleep gets short later. Studies show it works best for planned tough periods like long shifts, wedding, travel, or night duties, not as a fix for ongoing poor sleep

title: 'Ye toh hamara dost hai': Rohit Sharma's banter with security goes viral - WATCH
description: Rohit Sharma displayed his friendly nature at Ranchi airport, playfully vouching for his cricketer friend Shahbaz Nadeem to security personnel. The heartwarming moment, captured on video, showed Rohit putting his arm around Nadeem as they walked, a gesture appreciated by fans. Sharma is in Ranchi for the upcoming ODI series against South Africa.

title: PM Modi unveils ‘tallest’ Ram statue in South Goa, says ‘path to Viksit Bharat through unity of people’
Hong Kong’s worst fire in generations fuels scrutiny of safety lapses
Tourists stuck 120ft up in air: Sky dining goes wrong in Kerala; rescue under way
Eternity movie review: A rare A24 Films misfire
Why has the BMC tightened the rules for erection of hoardings in city after a gap of 17 years?
Booster shot! India's GDP grows at 8.2% in Q2; beats expectations - top highlights
description: India's economy surged past expectations, posting an impressive 8.2% real GDP growth in the second quarter of FY 2025-26, the highest in six quarters. This robust performance solidifies India's position as the world's fastest-growing major economy, driven by strong secondary and tertiary sector contributions. Private consumption also showed a healthy uptick.

title: ‘Does not deserve any sympathy’: Chandigarh court sentences taxi driver to life for 2010 MBA student rape-murder
Kim Soo Hyun’s lawyer accuses Kim Sae Ron’s family of ‘manipulation, false narratives’, Gold Medallist CEO resigns

Mark Carney tells Canadians - US tariffs will wipe $50 billion from Canada's economy
description: Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney is rolling back climate rules and encouraging pipeline construction to boost the energy sector amidst US tariff uncertainty. This move aims to diversify oil exports and reduce reliance on the US market, though it sparks internal government tensions and environmentalist criticism.

title: ‘Foreigners facing trial in India entitled to protection under Article 21’: Rajasthan High Court orders speedy trial
Watch: PM Modi unveils 77-ft statue of Lord Ram; launches Ramayana Theme Park
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi unveiled a 77-foot bronze statue of Lord Ram in Goa during the 550th-year celebrations of Shree Samsthan Gokarn Partagali Jeevottam Math. Earlier, he visited Udupi, Karnataka, offering prayers at Sri Krishna Matha and participating in a mass recitation of the Srimad Bhagavad Gita.

Exclusive | 'Not a surprise': Dutch No. 1 Giri on Divya-Sindarov WC wins
description: Uzbekistan's Javokhir Sindarov, at 19, became the youngest FIDE World Cup champion, mirroring India's Divya Deshmukh, also 19, who achieved the same feat in the Women's World Cup. While both were lower seeds, Dutch Grandmaster Anish Giri suggests their wins are coincidental, attributing them to the unpredictable nature of short match formats rather than a hidden trend among top players.

title: Zootopia 2 movie review: Zootopia sequel has bark but also bite
Maharashtra local polls can proceed, but don’t breach 50% reservation cap in places where election not yet notified: SC
India gets 'major power' status: Op Sindoor boosts military ranking - report
description: India has achieved 'major power' status, ranking third in Asia according to the Lowy Institute's Power Index. This rise is attributed to its growing economic and military strengths, notably boosted by recent combat experience in Operation Sindoor. While India leads Japan and Russia, a significant gap remains with China and the US, the top two superpowers.

title: A stay on Ranveer Singh’s Dhurandhar demanded by Major Mohit Sharma’s parents: ‘Not a commercial commodity’
Indian student shows Chinese University’s ‘5-star’ cafeteria with diet charts, weighing machine; meals for just Rs 250

No title in 2025: 'Can't jump to the next peak' — Abhinav Bindra on Gukesh's form slump
description: Olympic champion Abhinav Bindra offers perspective on D Gukesh's recent chess performance dip, calling it a natural phase post-major success. Bindra emphasizes returning to basics and recharging energy, both physically and mentally, to overcome such periods. He notes that in sports, past achievements fade, and continuous effort and finding joy are key to navigating these cycles.

title: Zohran Mamdani fails ultimate Bollywood quiz, unable to guess Shah Rukh Khan’s iconic songs
Major Mohit Sharma’s family takes legal action against Ranveer Singh’s ‘Dhurandhar’
description: Major Mohit Sharma's parents have sued filmmakers of Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar', alleging unauthorized exploitation of their martyred son's life. They claim the film, presented as inspired by true events, falsely links the protagonist to Major Sharma's covert operations. The family seeks to halt the December 5 release, citing privacy and national security concerns.

Trump threatens to halt migration for good: Which countries count as ‘Third World’?
description: In a bold move, US President Donald Trump announced his intention to completely stop immigration from 'developing nations,' highlighting issues of national security and ineffective policies. His agenda includes cracking down on illegal entries, expelling potential threats, and restricting benefits for non-citizens.

title: Shubhangi Atre wraps up her journey on Bhabiji Ghar Par Hain; shares emotional moments
description: Shubhangi Atre has bid adieu to her decade-long role as Angoori Bhabhi in 'Bhabiji Ghar Par Hain', sharing an emotional farewell with her cast and crew. Expressing gratitude for the show that gave her 'everything', Atre is now set to explore new artistic avenues. Shilpa Shinde will reprise the iconic character, marking a new chapter for the popular sitcom.

14 more district unit chiefs remaining to be named, all eyes on who will be the next UP BJP chief
Delhi car blast: Al-Falah chancellor forged papers to grab land of deceased Hindu owners
description: Enforcement Directorate has alleged that Al-Falah University chancellor Javed Ahmed Siddiqui fraudulently obtained Delhi land by forging documents of deceased Hindu landowners. The agency claims a fake General Power of Attorney, dated 2004, was used to transfer property in Madanpur Khadar to a trust linked to Siddiqui.  The investigation into this alleged land scam is ongoing with Siddiqui in ED custody.

title: MLB rumors: Mets could target $15M Padres starter after Dylan Cease deal
description: The New York Mets are reportedly eyeing San Diego Padres pitcher Michael King as their next major acquisition following Dylan Cease's record-breaking contract. King, who excelled as a starter before a mid-season injury, now represents a high-upside option for the Mets amidst a shifting pitching market.  His potential return to peak form makes him an intriguing target.

title: Nick Fuentes demands proof after Candace Owens links Macron, Kirk to plot
description: Candace Owens' explosive claims on X, alleging French President Macron and his wife paid for her assassination and French Legion soldiers killed Charlie Kirk, have been met with skepticism. Right-wing commentator Nick Fuentes publicly demanded proof, calling her stories 'crazy' and lacking evidence, particularly mocking her claims about Brigitte Macron's family history and gender.

title: Harvard-trained doctor lists warning signs of fatty liver that one should never miss
description: Fatty liver can creep up on you without any overt symptoms, but your body may be sending out warning signs. According to Dr. Saurabh Sethi, unexpected weight gain around the belly, increased blood sugar levels, darker urine, ongoing fatigue, and discomfort in the upper abdomen are all red flags.

title: Myles Garrett’s new romance: Olympic icon Chloe Kim revealed as his girlfriend
description: Cleveland Browns star Myles Garrett and Olympic snowboarding champion Chloe Kim have confirmed their relationship, sparking fan interest. Kim, a two-time gold medalist, is celebrated for her talent and authentic personality. Their union highlights a rare, genuine support between elite athletes in different sports, with both pursuing their respective careers with mutual admiration.

title: Google chips threaten Nvidia: Stock drops $250bn; claims 'we lead industry'
description: Nvidia's stock plummeted by $250 billion after reports surfaced of Meta Platforms considering significant spending on Google's competing AI chips. This move signals a potential shift in the AI hardware market, with Google's TPUs emerging as a credible alternative to Nvidia's dominant position.
